text: Pours a pale golden color with a white head. Grass, floral, light hop and cracker aroma. Floral, grass, herb, grain and cracker flavors. Light body and average carbonation. Grass and floral finish.

Pours a clear golden yellow on tap with fluffy white head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma and taste of light pale malts, grassy hop notes, and clean lager yeast esters. Great, to style, well done, but not my style when its cold.

Tap. Pours clear straw, medium creamy white head, great lacing. Aroma is light, grain, grass, hints of corn. Flavor is very light sweet, light plus bitter, grassy, a touch metallic. Light body, lingering bitterness
Tap poured clear light yellow with a medium white head and nice lacing. Aromas of corn, light Noble hop, and malt. Flavor is mild sweet to a somewhat dry bitter finish.
Tap at the brewpub. Clear light gold pour with a white head. Slightly syrupy, grain, light lemon, and some grassiness. Killer for the style.
On tap at Russian River Brewing, big hop aroma and flavor for a pilsner. My new favorite for this style.
Tap. Crystal clear yellow with a clean white head. Smells of lemon, spice and malt. Taste is sweet grain, lemon, spice, light malt, and light bitter. Light body.

Pretty generic pilsner. A bit soapy tasting. Not a huge fan. Color was at least nice, I guess. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a mildly cloudy light yellow golden. Lemon, lettuce, and some grass on the nose. Wet mouthfeel with a little scrubbiness around the edges and rear of the tongue. Sweet up front, but finishes bitter. Extraordinarily drinkable.

Draught @ Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa, CA
Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, floral, grass and hay. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is light to medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

On tap at the brewpub. It pours a clear, pale golden and a white head. Grass, hay, portable malts and a fruity touch in the aroma. Theres a nice bitterness in the flavor, with some hay and pale malts. Medium to thin body, pleasant carbonation. A bit boring this one, by far from bad. 130806

On tap at the brewpub. Pours clear yellow with a white head. Aroma of herbal and spicy hops with some malt and grains. Flavor is sweet and malty with some floral and herbal notes with some grains. Medium body, average carbonation.

On tap at the brewpub. It pours a light orange/yellow with a white head. The aroma has some big herbal and citrusy hops. The mouthfeel is nice and creamy with some big noble hop bitterness. Pretty nice one, but clearly not a style that they specialize in.
Probably the best pilsner Ive ever had. Not particularly my type of beer but very smooth and full of flavor.

On tap at Russian River. Poured yellow and fizzy. Aroma is grassy, has a nice hint of lemon. Flavor is a bit standard, nicely hopped. Overall a decent beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aug 8, 2011 at brewpub.  Super light pale yellow.  White petri head.  Light honey and hay.  Taste is pale malt and light bitter.  Honey behind.  Just a lager.  Was hoping for something huge or large.  This wasnt it.

big thanks to Kan for sharing this growler after a rainy walk home from gtmw, seemed like the perfect time for this one. Pours hazed yellow with foamy white head. Nose grassy, pepper, floral. Flavors nice pepper, floral, sweet grainy, bit too sweet but very good.
On tap at the brewery.  Creamy oak pils taste.  lemon and hay.  light malts.  Thats really all I have in my note.  I guess I liked it.  7.6

A - Served a hazy golden-yellow color with a finger of frothy white head atop and lots of visible carbonation. The head faded down slowly leaving behind some nice lacing in the process.

S - Aroma was a mix of yeast with some banana character, some grains, and some lemon. There was also some light hops and spices in the background.

T - Starts off with some good yeast flavor and some slightly tart lemon. Through the middle, the tartness fades and some grain flavor replaces it with some hops and light spices coming through. The finish is a mix of yeast and grain flavors that linger nicely.

M - Medium-light bodied with moderate-plus lively carbonation. Feels super smooth and crisp without being watery or thin.

D - Very drinkable. The flavors blend really nicely here and are a bit stronger than many pilsners. However, the beer still retains the great tradition mouthfeel and crispness of a good pilsner.

Russian river pils. Growler much thanks to ken for sending this...  
Golden hazy golden hue with a creamy white head... Aroma of bready soft grain and a light lemony citrus hop component... Flavors are light lemony citrus notes alongside some grains with a medium bitterness towards the backend.  the beer itself is entirely quaffable. lighter bodied, as expected, with a decent level of carbonation to add to it.  solid offering and an easy drinker for sure.
8/4/8/4/15

Growler shared by Kan. Pours well hazed golden straw pour,  well hazed with a nice frothy offwhite head, dies down with a small thicker ring. Aromas are toasty breads, flaked wheat, dry grass and florals. A mellow touch of spice, faint bread dough yeast. Initial is lighter bodied, dry and bready, touches of flaked cereal grains. Dry grass, florals, a touch of spice. Backend throws mellow sweet cereak grains, touch of toast, with dry florals and grass. Finish is lingering light bread yeast, dry hops. Clean and well hopped. A healthy dryness, grass and spice. Really great sessioner full of flavor and good healthy hops.
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2011 Draft at RR... Pissy light neon straw, light white head... Light sweet grains, with a bit of hops on the back... Light wet skunky grain, not a big fan
Lemon noble hops tang medium high effervescence nice and drinkable at 4.55 herbal and only lightly bitter. Great easy drinking!

Got a growler of this @ Russian River. Poured into my new sound Czech boot glass. Aroma is great, has a nice hint of lemon. Flavor is also great, I love the bitterness level of this beer. I noticed all of their lighter stuff was nicely hopped. Overall a great beer!

Draft @ Russian River (finally!). ABV listed as 4.55%, unfiltered. Pours a hazy, effervescent, whitish-yellow color; creamy, fine-bubbled white head with great retention and lacing; delicious-looking. Minerally, lightly herbal hoppiness in the aroma; a touch of citrus; crisp, toasty, vibrant hoppiness. Medium body; lively carbonation; rich, toasty Pils maltiness with a nice core roundness, bolstered by juicy citrus and noble mineral and lightly herbal hop character; a moderate core bitterness with a lot of vibrant hop flavor; some yeasty and vanilla notes in there as well; just a kickass unfiltered Pils that was totally worth the wait; happy birthday, Vinnie! Happy Saturday, me. Medium-length finish; toasty, lingering citrus and mineral bitterness; toasty and dry at the far end.

On tap at Russian River in August 2009.

A: Pours a dark straw color with a nice white head and good lacing as it goes down. Plenty of carbonation bubbles visible through the transparent brew.

S: Lots of Noble hops accompany a solid pilsner malt base.

T: The hops dominate atop a slightly-sweet and grainy malt base.

M: A little heavier than most pilsners, while still maintaining a nice, smooth mouthfeel with the right amount of carbonation.

D: Quite drinkable and very sessionable. This one and the Aud Blonde were nice surprises at RR--some very solid sessionable beers from what a great brewery.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-04-2009

Hand bottle shared by iowaherkeye. Thanks! Poured a clear light orange color with a fizzy white head. Pleasant aroma of Euro-trash hops (Saaz), pale malt, and hay. I also got a whiff of bacon. Thats right, bacon. Light to medium bodied and dry with mild to moderate bitterness. Tasted of pine, fresh saaz, pale malt/cereal grain, and hay. Great pilsener.

A golden pils with a thick creamy white head. A light malt aroma with some bready note, german hops, very classy. In mouth, a biscuitty malt with strong Saaz hops, smooth yet HUGE. On tap at Russian River Beer and BBQ Revival, August 15 2009.
Tap at Stone 13th Anniversary Celebration. Pours a clear bodied golden hue. Decent light maltiness, some breadiness, and a touch of hops. Solid for the style.
On tap at the stone 13th fest.  Nice pilsner.  Clear gold pour, white head.  Light malty biscuits, fresh hop bitterness, and some grassiness.  Easy drinking.

I thought this was very well done for a Pilsner. Certainly modeled after the crisp bitterness in PIlsner Urquell, the beer surprised me. I am not a Pilsner fan whatsoever, but I would drink this beer all summer long. Thick for its style, and bitter enough to drive home some flavor, it was perfect with some pizza from the RR pub.
Clear dark yellow with a fizzy white head. Floral hops and cereal grain aroma. Crisp citrus and grain taste.

Bottle shared from iowaherkeye.  Odd vegetable aromas, some lemon initially.  Golden color with an off white head.  Rich enough with dryish flavors and some cheesiness. Palate is pretty creamy. Rich developing flavor.  Good.

On tap at the brewpub.  Mostly hazy, pale straw colored body with a finger of fizzy white head.  Moderate herbal/spicy noble hop aroma with a faint, crackery pils malt note in the background.  Clean and fresh aroma.  Not as inviting of a pils malt aroma as Id like, but the juiciness of the hop aroma is certainly welcome.  Light bodied, moderately carbonated mouthfeel with a soft, silky texture.  Light crackery malt presence up front, followed quickly by a powerful herbal hop flavor.  Intensely hoppy, with an herbal/spicy character that almost approaches grapefruit in quality, but still maintains a "noble" hop perception.  Finishes dry, with a refreshing hop bitterness lingering on the palate.  This is an awesome, summertime refreshing pilsner example with a hop flavor that provides stiff competition for prima pils.  The board stated 33IBUs, but my perception would be more in the 45-50 range.  A little bit more pils malt complexity would be nice, but the mouthfeel is right on and I wouldnt want that to get in the way of the hop character.  Overall, a very enjoyable beer.

Tap at the brewpub.  Slightly hazy yellowish-golden color with a white head.  Aroma of grassy/citrus hops and pale malt.  Flavor is more of the same, with the hops very fresh-tasting and prominent.  Almost like a pilsner IPA.  Palate slightly dry and fairly full for the style (but still medium-light in the grand scheme of things).  One of the best pilsners Ive ever had.

On tap @ the brewpub, chalkboard states 5.7% and 33 IBUs.  Hazy golden straw with creamy one finger head, great retention.  Floral and grassy hops in the nose, with some sweet biscuits and fresh pasta as well.  The flavor adds just a hint of citrus hops.  The finish is dry with bitterness at a 4.  Medium body with light to moderate carbonation.  Excellent lacing.  A very good pils, but I still prefer Reality Czech.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: At the brewery during RBSG09.   Hazy yellow with a lasting head.   Super fresh citrus, spicy, and lightly grassy hop aroma.   Clean pale malt flavors with lots of green, grassy, citric, spicy hop flavors and a dry, bitter finish.   Light bodied with medium  carbonation.   Not a classic Bohemian hop profile, but very nice and hoppy stuff.

RBSG09 on tap at the brewpub. Pours a hazy light dirty gold color with a wet filmy white head. Scent of oranges and lemons with some interesting spicy hops. Cereal grain flavor with orange peels, and lemon meringue. Almost tastes ale-like. Lightly sweet with a dry finish.

Handbottle from IrishBoy.  Golden with a thin white head.  Aroma is light citrus, with some hoppiness peaking through, and malts.  Taste is malty, nice hoppiness showing through, nice depth with the malts that were used though.

A bonus hand bottle from irishboy.  Ummm,  you already sent some pliny for no reason!  Shared among a few,  we all appreciate it.  Pours gold with a nice white head.  Aroma is as expected,  wheaty, yeasty,  a bit of funk.  Flavor is similar with a nice hop profile going on.  grassy,  grainy,  some malt.  Finishes a bit boozy,  I put this around 8% having known nothing about it.  This is probably the best beer of this style Ive had,  just not my thing.

(hand bottle from irishboy.thanks man!light orange body with a small white head.the aroma blends up melon,hay,and a tiny wiff of hops.the flavor is dominated by biscuits type malt,and is followed up by some melon,hay,and again a small hop presence.overall pretty solid.full flavor for a 5% beer.

Draft at the brewpub.  VERY pale yellow color with a white head.   Toasted malt aroma with a hint of hops.  More toasted malts in the flavor.   Tons of hops.  Pretty unlike any other B. Pils Ive ever tried.

Tap @ Russian River.  Poured a clear gold color with a large white head.  Floral hops and a light sweet malt make up the flavor.  Crisp bitter finish with a light body and a medium length to the finish.  Semi-sweet.  The aroma was floral and citrus hopped.

1/3/08 with BikesandBeer, 9th Brewery of the trip, 2nd of the Day.  Finally got to come here.  Pours yellow clear with a bright white ring.  Nose is light to non existent.  Taste is very nice upfront, with a nice balance of bitternesss and a nice sweetness.
Draft at the Brewpub; Big nose of grassy hops; clear gold with a big white head; flavor of mild hop bitterness along with some graininess! An excellent Pilsener with great hoppiness!
Tap: Clear gold with a white head.  The aroma is earthy and has some farts.  Crisp flavor with mainly grains and hairspray from an aerosol can.  Good for a pils.
Hazy golden. Aroma is big grassy hops, bread, some buttery goodness. Medium bodied, bittersweet finish. Big flavors for a pils. One of the best tasting, but lacked the drinkability.

From tap this beer came out clear blonde with a nice white head.  Strong grassy hop aroma and malt.  This beer fills your mouth with flavor.  Lots of malt but finished with lots of grassy hops that balances nicely.  Left me wanting another.
A Czech IPA! Refreshing and dry with a nice grassy hop character. This a session beer par-excellance. If only Vinnie would make this year round.
